intro: Vicia grenieri, commonly known as the Grenier's vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its small, pea-like flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters along the stems. Vicia grenieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding vegetation.
